attributes.action: Call a General Election to coincide with the 11th June 2009 European Parliament Elections.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We petition the current Prime Minister of the United Kingdom, Gordon Brown, to allow the public to decide who they want to lead this country and hold a General Election on the 11.06.09.

Since taking over as Prime Minister in June 2007, there has been much public and media protest against the current government, much of which relates to the fact that the people of this country never had a chance to vote for who they want to lead the country.

This issue needs to be "put to bed" so government can get on and lead the country through the tough times ahead, and the people can feel assured in the fact they have had their say on which is the best government for the job...

There is nothing to fear from letting the people of the country have their say by calling an election and everything to gain. I have faith in the prime minister to listen to his electorate, the people of this country and let them go to the polls to decide the future direction the country will take, and who will lead them there.
